etymology.interpretation: Fruit name plus 'skin' denotes the outer rind of an orange. In contrast, dried citrus peel used in TCM is commonly written 陈皮 (chénpí).

examples.chinese: 我喜欢用橙皮做果酱(我喜歡用橙皮做果醬)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān yòng chéngpí zuò guǒjiàng.
examples.english: I like to use orange peel to make marmalade.

examples.chinese: 她把橙皮晒干(她把橙皮曬乾)，用来泡茶(用來泡茶)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ chéngpí shài gān, yònglái pào chá.
examples.english: She dries the orange peel to brew tea.

examples.chinese: 橙皮富含芳香油(橙皮富含芳香油)，能增加菜肴的香气(能增加菜餚的香氣)。
examples.pinyin: Chéngpí fùhán fāngxiāng yóu, néng zēngjiā càiyáo de xiāngqì.
examples.english: Orange peel is rich in aromatic oils and can enhance a dish’s fragrance.
